intro: Otiophora spirospicata, commonly known as the spiral-spined liverwort, is a small, mat-forming plant belonging to the family Pottioideae. It is characterized by its intricate, spiral-shaped thallus with spines that give it its common name. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. Its structure consists of leaf-like structures called phyllidia, which are arranged in a spiral pattern. Otiophora spirospicata plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitat for various small organisms.
